Robert: What does the surname Robert mean?

The surname Robert is of Old German origin and primarily found in France and England. The name is derived from the personal name Robert, a compound of the elements "hrod", meaning "renown", and "berht", meaning "bright" or "famous". Therefore, the last name Robert generally means "famed" or "bright with renown". It became a popular given name after being introduced to England by the Normans in the form Robertus. Over time, the name evolved into a surname, often indicating a lineage tracing back to an ancestor named Robert. In many cultures, especially in Western societies, Robert is considered a highly prestigious surname due to its long-standing history and noble connotations.

Robert: Where does the name Robert come from?

The last name "Robert" is most common in France, according to WorldNames PublicProfiler. In France, it is the 14th most popular name. It is also a very popular name in the United States, where it ranks 72nd among the most popular surnames.

Robert is also a popular name in Canada, where it ranks 39th among surnames. It is also found in smaller numbers in Germany, the United Kingdom, and Australia. Those countries rank "Robert" well within the top 200 most common surnames.

Meanwhile, in other countries around the world like Brazil, Poland, Sweden, and even India, Robert remains among the top 500 most common surnames.

The origin of the name is believed to come from the Germanic name "Hrodbert", which combines hrod (renown) and bert (bright). Today, "Robert" is used as both a first and surname, and can also be found in various spellings around the world, like Robar, Robard, and Robertson.

Variations of the surname Robert

The surname Robert has many variants, spellings, and surnames of the same origin. Robert is derived from the Germanic name Hrodebert, which means “bright fame.” Common variants of the surname Robert include Robard, Robarts, Robarts, Robards, Robbards, Robbards, Robbins, Robben, Robbing, Robins, Robson, Robinsons, Robin, Robeson, and Robison.

Variations of this surname can also be seen in other European nations, such as France, where the name is found as Robin or Robinet. In Scotland, the name is often found as Robison or Robeson. In Ireland, the surname Robaan and Robain can be found.

In England, many variants are associated with the name, such as Robarts, Robers, and Roberts. Robartson, Robison, and Robson are also found in England, as well as variants such as Robbin or Robbinet.

In addition, multiple surnames are derived from Robert, such as Robertson, Robertson, Roberts, Robinson, Robison, Robson, and Robins.

The variations of Robert can be found in many forms, from geography and dialect to cultural background. No matter what form it takes, it is an enduring and popular name, with influences from many countries, cultures, and eras.

Famous people with the name Robert

Robert De Niro: American actor, director, producer and entrepreneur, best known for films like Taxi Driver, Raging Bull, The Godfather Part II and Goodfellas.

Robert Downey Jr.: American actor, producer and musician, best known for roles in Iron Man, The Avengers, Sherlock Holmes and Tropic Thunder.

Robert Redford: American actor, director, producer and entrepreneur, best known for roles in The Way We Were, All the President's Men, Out of Africa and The Natural.

Robert Plant: English singer, songwriter and musician, best known as the prolific lead singer and lyricist of the iconic rock band Led Zeppelin.

Robert Smith: English singer, songwriter, multi-instrumentalist and record producer, best known as the lead singer, guitarist and principal songwriter of the rock band the Cure.

Robert Wagner: American actor, best known for roles in classic films such as The Star, Hart to Hart and Austin Powers.

Robert Duvall: American actor, director, producer and musician, best known for roles in The Godfather, Apocalypse Now, The Natural and SPort.

Robert Englund: American actor, director, voice actor and comedian, best known for tentacles as the villainous Freddy Krueger in the A Nightmare on Elm Street.

Robert Pattinson: British actor, model and musician, best known for playing Count Dracula in the Twilight franchise and Christian Grey in the Fifty Shades franchise.

Robert Kardashian: American lawyer and ex-husband of Kris Jenner, best known for being the father of Kim, Khloe, Kourtney and Rob Kardashian.
